formattedAddress: 210 W 118th St, New York, NY 10026, USA
adrFormatAddress: 210 W 118th St, New York, NY 10026, USA

editorialSummary.text: Upscale American cuisine & brunch in a polished, modern dining room with a lounge & piano bar.

originalText.text: The Cecil is obviously an institution. That being said, our experience was mixed. The atmosphere is wonderful. The decoration is beautiful. The waiter who looked after us was incredibly kind and present. The starters were really good... But then the mains were satisfactory to disappointing. The meats were all over cooked and one person on our table got the wrong cut of meat. After a few back and forth, it turns out the kitchen made a mistake... But nothing was done about it. We ordered lava cakes for desert and received something different... Again, nothing was done to correct the situation. Our waiter was terribly embarrassed and apologized on behalf of the kitchen and management. The overall experience was fun, and we're happy we visited, but for the price paid, we would have liked less mistakes or more done by management to correct them.

originalText.text: I rarely/never give places 5 stars, but baby, this place is amazing! The food was soooo good. I had the soup and a shrimp salad. But I also got to taste my friends plates. They had steak, lamb and fried chicken. It was alll VERY GOOD. The ambiance was top notch. We got to dance with the person putting on the amazing show. I could go on all day... I would come back here again and again.

originalText.text:
I accidently ran into this place. I have been in the neighborhood for 20 years and never knew of this place. The decor was beautiful and jazz looking. Service was wonderful and the food was great. They even had a comedy show available the night I was there. I simply sat at the bar.

Went again the following week to imtroduce my friend to this place for drink and food. She loved it.

originalText.text: Nice spot but the service was not so good. There was one person working the whole damn floor at one point. So that meant our group amd the other groups that were there were not tended to as we should have been. The guy walking around tried to spruce things up by celebrating EVERYONE...birthday, anniversary, graduation, retirement...whatever. It was a nice way to liven things up but service needs major work.

originalText.text: First time visit for a holiday gathering in the private room.   Fantastic evening.   Everything was great!  The food was absolutely delicious.   The "Jack Punch" was the best!! üçπ  The calamari was delicious,  but needed a pinch of salt.
